head.supplied: Melbourne, 17/12/91. ¶ T. R. Wilson Esqr, ¶ Under Secretary. ¶ Sir. ¶ ¶ In reply to your memorandum, numbered 6112, ¶ received this day, I have the honor to state, that the following works are under...

div.p: S91/11991, unit 663, VPRS 3992/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

In reply to your memorandum, numbered 6112,
See T. Wilson to M, 17 December 1891. received this day, I have the honor to state, that the following works are under progress and elaboration officially by myself:
1, The second edition of the "Key to the System of Victorian Plants", which will contain all additional observations, instituted since 1885 and also numerous additional illustrations.
2, the "third Census of Australian plants, which work by recent discoveries requires much enlargement.

3, the completing parts of the publication on "Papuan Plants", as a record of the species, occurring in British New Guinea, and contained in our collections here. I will do all I can to bring these works as early to a close, as is consistent with accuracy of research, but I cannot hope to have them completed much within two years from now.
See T. Wilson to M, 31 December 1891. See also M to A. McLean, 28 November 1891, and M to A. McLean, 1 January 1892.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be,

div.p:
Gov. Botanist.
A typescript copy of this MS is enclosed with M to T. Wilson, 16 January 1892.
